02/02/2011~~~food for thought~~~FREELY LOVE, FREELY SHARE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one. Love the LORD 
your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength." - Deuteronomy 6:4-5 

Our Lesson for Today:
The key to a Christ-like life is: Love. with all. God's command is that we love Him
above all else. This law was given in the very beginning to Adam and Eve in paradise.
If they had loved the Lord their God, they would not have transgressed His precept. 

God's desire is that His people love Him with total sincerity, without reservation, and
with all their faculties. Yes, we should give to God the most precious thing we have, 
that is, our mind, for we have nothing better than that. 

When we have paid our debt to our Creator, then we may labor for men, to show them
kindness, and to give help. The corrupt nature in us can not produce this perfect
obedience. Doubts concerning both the anger and mercy of God cling in our heart. 

No one fears God as he ought. No one is so on fire with love as he ought to be.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, we thank you for parents, relatives, friends, and pastors 
who seek Your Word in purity and truth. Use us [me] now as an instrument 
for the salvation of others. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging our inability to love You with the fullness and sincerity that You deserve. Our minds are often clouded by doubts and our affections divided, unable to give You the complete devotion that Your perfect law demands. Lord, we pray that by Your Spirit, You would ignite in us a fervent love for You, that we may love You with all our heart, soul, and strength, and that this love would overflow into loving service for others. Forgive us for our shortcomings, and empower us to walk in obedience to Your commands. Amen.

02/03/2011~~~food for thought~~~GOD HAS PREPARED ALL THINGS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"However, as it is written: "What no eye has seen, what no ear has heard, 
and what no human mind has conceived"- the things God has prepared for 
those who love him-" - 1 Corinthians 2:9 

Our Lesson for Today:
There are a couple of verses that I want to share with you that are of the utmost 
importance as a follow up to (1 Cor. 2:9). 

First, (Jm. 1:12) Blessed is the man who remains steadfast under trial, 
for when he has stood the test he will receive the crown of life, 
which God has promised to those who love Him. 

Second, (Mt. 25:34) Then the King will say to those one His right, Come, you who 
are blessed by My Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the
foundation of the world. 

Third, (Isa. 64:4) From of old no one has heard or perceived by the ear, no eye 
has seen a God besides you, who acts for those who wait for him. 

The Spirit reveals God's mysteries through the Gospel, even though the words
Paul writes, "depths of God". There will always be mysteries about God's 
person and nature, but we are given a glimpse of His ways through the cross. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank you for revealing Yourself to me by Your cross. 
Receive this weak sinner and strengthen me for Your service. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Though we cannot fully comprehend the depths of Your ways, we trust that You work all things together for the good of those who are called according to Your purpose. Give us the steadfast faith to endure trials, that we may receive the crown of life You have promised. May we eagerly await the day when we inherit the eternal kingdom You have prepared from the foundation of the world. In Jesus' name, Amen.

02/04/2011~~~food for thought~~~DEPEND UPON OUR ROCK

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"But I will sing of Your strength, in the morning I will sing of Your love; 
for You are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble." - Psalm 59:16 

Our Lesson for Today:
Basically we see this message repeated in Ps. 21:13; Ps. 46:1; Ps. 59:16
and Ps. 101:1. 

David may have written these Psalm early in his reign as king as he set down
the standards he wanted to follow. ~ it seems quiet obvious in Ps. 101. 

David knew that to lead a blameless life he would need God's help (101:2).
We can lead blameless lives lives if we avoid: 
(1) looking at wickedness ("I will refuse to look at anything vile and vulgar," 101:3)
(2) evil thoughts ("perverse ideas," 101:4)
(3) Slander (101:5) and
(4) pride (101:5)

While avoiding these wrongs, we must also let God's Word show us the 
standards by which to live, for He is our refuge. 

Prayer Suggestion:
I praise You, Lord, for all Your glorious power.
I thank You for answering my prayers. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Help us, like David, to set standards that align with Your Word, avoiding wickedness, evil thoughts, slander, and pride. May we find our delight in doing Your will and living according to Your righteous ways. Guide us, Lord, that we may dwell in Your presence and glorify Your name. Amen.

02/06/ 2011~~~food for thought~~~GOD IS WORTHY OF OUR PRAISE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"For the word of the LORD is right and true; 
he is faithful in all he does. 
The LORD loves righteousness and justice; 
the earth is full of his unfailing love." - Psalm 33:4-5 

Our Truth for Today:
"All" God's words are true and trustworthy. The Bible is reliable because,
unlike us, God does not lie, forget, change His words, or leave promises
unfulfilled. 

We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a holy, trustworthy 
and unchangeable God. 

Prayer Suggestion:
I thank You Lord, that Your word is true and trustworthy. Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: "All" God's words are true and trustworthy. The Bible is reliable because, unlike us, God does not lie, forget, change His words, or leave promises unfulfilled. We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a holy, trustworthy and unchangeable God.
original_verse_text: "For the word of the LORD is right and true; he is faithful in all he does. The LORD loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of his unfailing love."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the truth and reliability of Your Word. Your promises never fail, and Your words are steadfast and sure. Help us to trust in the unwavering faithfulness of Your Scriptures, which reveal Your eternal plan of salvation. May we find comfort and hope in the knowledge that You are a God who cannot lie, but who always keeps His word. In Your Son's name we pray. Amen.
reflection: "All" God's words are true and trustworthy. The Bible is reliable because, unlike us, God does not lie, forget, change His words, or leave promises unfulfilled. We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a holy, trustworthy, and unchangeable God.

02/07/2011~~~food for thought~~~GOD APPROVES OF FORESIGHT AND RESTRAINT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Proverbs 21:20 
20 The wise store up choice food and olive oil, 
but fools gulp theirs down. 

Our Lesson for Today:
This lesson is really about saving for the future.

Easy credit today has caused many people to live on the edge of bankruptcy.
The desire to keep up appearances and the desire to accumulate more drives 
many people to spend every penny they earn, and they stretch their credit to
the limit. 

But anyone who spends all he has is spending more than he can afford.
But a wise person puts money aside for hard times. God approves of
foresight and restraint. 

A wise person needs to examine his/her life-style to see whether their 
spending is God-pleasing or merely self-pleasing. 

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Dear Lord, keep my eyes always focused on You
and Your blessing, which are mine by grace alone. Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

02/09/2011~~~food for thought~~~HELP ME TO BE OF GREATER SERVICE

Our Bible Verses for To Day:
"[Love for Enemies] "You have heard that it was said, 'Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.' 
But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, that you may be children 
of your Father in heaven. He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the 
righteous and the unrighteous." - Matthew 5:43-45 

Our Lesson for Today:
"love your enemies" ~ What Jesus commands is not about emotions but as loving actions.
Remember when Jesus Himself was stripped, beaten and blasphemed by the soldiers,
scribes, Pharisees, officers and priests not even then did He pronounce any maliciousness 
against them. 

Do you remember what He did and said? He prayed, saying: "Father forgive them."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, though I often fall short of Your perfection,
forgive my sins for Jesus sake, and strengthen me for greater service
and love for my fellow man. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Do you remember what He did and said? He prayed, saying: "Father forgive them."

But I tell you, love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, that you may be children of your Father in heaven. He causes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the righteous and the unrighteous.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to follow the example of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Help us to love our enemies, as You have loved us, and to extend forgiveness even in the face of persecution and injustice. May we have the strength to pray, as Jesus did, "Father, forgive them," recognizing that our own need for grace is great. Grant us the wisdom and courage to love our adversaries and do good to those who hate us, that we may truly be Your children. In Jesus' name, Amen.

02/10/2011~~~food for thought~~~PERSEVERANCE IN THE TIME OF TRIALS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
2 Thessalonians 1:3-4 

Thanksgiving and Prayer
3 We ought always to thank God for you, brothers and sisters, and rightly so, 
because your faith is growing more and more, and the love all of you have for 
one another is increasing. 
4 Therefore, among God's churches we boast about your perseverance and 
faith in all the persecutions and trials you are enduring. 

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul gives thanks for God's grace at work among the Thessalonians, by which
God has created faith and love in them.Paul points to the persecuted Thessalonians
as examples for other Christians of their time and ours. 

We, too, should "be imitators of God" (Eph. 5:1). ~ We must set an example to others 
in what we believe and in what we say and do for them; by living in faith and in love. 

Christ is in deed our example, but, much greater and higher than that, He is our Savior.
He suffered in our place, on account of our sins, for us!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I beg of You that You would strengthen me each time
I partake of Your Super in faith toward You and in fervent love
toward one another. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

02/11?2011~~~food for thought~~~LETTING OUR LOVE SHINE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, 
I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal. If I have the gift 
of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I 
have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. 
If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that 
I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing." - 1 Corinthians 13:1-3 

Our Lesson for Today:
Why has Paul made such a big thing about [Love] in this chapter?
Because love is a self-giving, sacrificial concern for others. The word
was esp. adopted by Christians; it characterizes God and is the basis
of His actions toward us in Christ. 

Those loved by God show love toward others. The weight of Paul's teaching 
about justification has obscured how frequently He emphasizes love in this 
chapter. He uses the term more often than even the apostle John in I Jn.

Suggested Prayer:
Dear all knowing Father, when my Christian brothers and sisters disappoint
and annoy me, help me to stretch out my arms and embrace them with Your 
all-embracing love through Jesus, our mutual Savior. Amen. 


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

The weight of Paul's teaching about justification has obscured how frequently He emphasizes love in this chapter. He uses the term more often than even the apostle John in I John.

If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for Your boundless love that has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit (Romans 5:5). Help us to walk in the way of love, as Christ loved us and gave Himself up for us (Ephesians 5:2). May our words, actions, and motivations be rooted in the self-giving, sacrificial concern for others that reflects Your character. Let love be the defining mark of our lives, for without it, we are nothing (1 Corinthians 13:1-3). In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.

02/12/2011~~~food for thought~~~LOVE COMES FROM A PURE HEART

Our Bible Verses for Today:
1 Corinthians 13:4 Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. 
5 It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. 
6 Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. 
7 It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres

The Lesson to be Learned:

We see by these verses that they are poetically balanced between negative 
and positive statements. There are fifteen assertions which describe the 
nature of love in Christ:

Two positive statements, eight negative statements (the last one adds a positive contrast),
then four positive statements. 

The first assertions are most important ("patient," "kind"). If you are wondering about God's 
attributes, look to (Ex. 34:6). 

The all important, 'lesson to be learned,' for me is:
"Love is patient, love is kind." If we strive to live by these two rules,
all that negative stuff will have no place in our lives. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me not only hear Your Word but also to keep it
in a pure heart, that it may produce a faithful life of service. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

The all important, 'lesson to be learned, ' for me is: "Love is patient, love is kind. " If we strive to live by these two rules, all that negative stuff will have no place in our lives.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to reflect the love that You have so graciously poured out upon us. Help us to be patient and kind, as Your Word instructs, that we may grow in our love for one another. May we put aside all selfishness and pride, and instead, honor and esteem our brothers and sisters in Christ. Guide us, Lord, to live out the truth that love is the greatest of all virtues. We ask this in the name of our Savior, Jesus Christ. Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, 
that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life." - John 3:16 

Our Lesson for Today:
Wow! ~ What a valentine present! ~ actually two presents. # 1 God gave His only 
Son as a sacrificial gift to deliver the world from condemnation and # 2 to give eternal 
life to those who believe in Him. 

When we continue in an immoral lifestyle, we naturally resist His divine disclosure
of our sin and thus our need for a Savior. Let us not flee the light, but repent.
God has revealed His strong love in His Son, Jesus Christ, to forgive your sins
and give you life.

Dear Heavenly Father, grant that my life may be a vivid 
testimony to Your sacrificial and faithful love in Christ. Amen.

02/15/2011~~~food for thought~~~LET US BE IMITATORS OF HIS LOVE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
""A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, 
so you must love one another. By this everyone will know that you are 
my disciples, if you love one another."" - John 13:34-35 

Our Lesson for Today:
God had previously commanded His people to love others, even at some cost,
but Jesus' sacrificial love sets a far higher standard than anything before. The 
disciples cannot follow Christ to the cross, but He asks them to imitate His love 
for them as they love one another. 

We, as Christians bring dishonor to Christ and His love when we deal with one 
another in a loveless manner. Christ redeemed us through His self-sacrificial
love that we may in turn imitate His love. 

Prayer Suggestion:
May Your love, O Lord, guide my every action. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"This is love: not that we loved God, but that he loved us and sent 
his Son as an atoning sacrifice for our sins." - 1 John 4:10 

The Lesson to be learned:
The thing to remember here is, we are not saved by our love for God
but by the love of God for us in sending Christ to be the atoning sacrifice
for our sins. 

Luther once said, "Provide yourselves with armor from Scripture concerning 
justification which takes place through faith. If you put your reliance on these
passages, you will be able to stand even after a fall. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, I confess that I have not always loved as I should.
Forgive me and work Your love in me and cast out all my doubts. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? Shall trouble or hardship or persecution 
or famine or nakedness or danger or sword? No, in all these things we are more than 
conquerors through Him who loved us." - Romans 8:35,37 

Our Lesson for Today:
Paul lists seven things that threaten to come between us and Christ's love, all of which 
Paul experienced so He answers the question himself with a definite "NO."

How is it possible Paul also gives the answer here too: We are conquerors through
Him who loved us. 

By His death on the cross Christ gained total victory for us. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, though You are exalted at the Father's right hand, 
You still hold us. Keep us in Your Love to the end. Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Though we may face trials, tribulations, and even death, we are more than conquerors through Him who loved us and gave Himself for us. We cling to the promise that neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, can ever separate us from Your eternal love. 02/19/2011~~~food for thought~~~NOTHING CAN SEPARATE US FROM THE LOVE OF CHRIST

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, 
neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, 
nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of 
God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord." - Romans 8:38-39 

Our Lesson for Today:
We have here a tenfold inventory of superhuman realities that threaten, in vain,
to break the grip of Christ's love. These unseen cosmic forces, even though 
created by God, they now stand in opposition to God's eternal purpose because
of the fall. 

They even threaten to separate us from Christ's love, but Christ has triumphed 
over them. Christ's death, resurrection, and exaltation at God's right hand
guarantees victory over anything and everything that would separate us from His 
love. 

When following Christ brings distress, we sometimes distance ourselves from Him.
But Christ never draws back from us. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, though You are exalted at the Father's right hand,
You still hold us near. Keep us in Your love to the end. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

These unseen cosmic forces, even though created by God, they now stand in opposition to God's eternal purpose because of the fall. They even threaten to separate us from Christ's love, but Christ has triumphed over them. Christ's death, resurrection, and exaltation at God's right hand guarantees victory over anything and everything that would separate us from His love. When following Christ brings distress, we sometimes distance ourselves from Him. But Christ never draws back from us.
original_verse_text: For I am convinced that neither death nor life, neither angels nor demons, neither the present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your strength and protection. In the face of unseen cosmic forces that seek to separate us from Your love, we cling to the promise found in Romans 8:38-39. Nothing can ever separate us from Your eternal love, for You have triumphed over all powers and principalities through the death and resurrection of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Grant us the courage and wisdom to stand firm in our faith, as we put on the full armor of God, as described in Ephesians 6. May we never distance ourselves from You, but rather draw ever closer, knowing that You will never draw back from us. We trust in Your unfailing love and unwavering presence. Amen.

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"Dear friends, since God so loved us, we also ought to love one another. 
No one has ever seen God; but if we love one another, God lives in us and 
his love is made complete in us." - 1 John 4:11-12

Our Lesson for Today: 
What kind of love is this? ~ ~ ~ Despite all our selfishness and sinfulness He
has loved us. In (1 Jn 3:1) we are even called His own children. God's love is
unique because it is not what our corrupt, sinful nature deserves; it is not
what our thoughts, words, and deeds have earned.

God has even promises that He has made us His children. ~ Despite the lies,
deceptions, and partial truths of the world, God has never lied to us, and He
has never failed to do what He has promised. ~ You can count on Him.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive my lack of real love for my brothers and sisters
in Christ, and enable me to love everyone as Jesus has loved me. Amen
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

02/21/2011~~~food for thought~~~LOVE COVERS A MULTITUDE OF SINS

Our Bible Verses for Today:
Hatred stirs up conflict, but 
love covers over all wrongs. Proverbs 10:12 
A perverse person stirs up conflict, 
and a gossip separates close friends. Proverbs 16:28

"Whoever would foster love covers over an offense, but whoever 
repeats the matter separates close friends." - Proverbs 17:9 

Our Lesson for Today:
What we should learn from these three verses is that "love" covers
all offenses. Speaking words of hatred only escalates strife, but 
words of forgiveness, prompted by love brings righteousness. 

Even though offenses occur love will overlook, forgive and yields to
them, not carrying all things to the extremity of justice.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray that Your saving love and forgiveness
will always be expressed through my lips. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

Even though offenses occur love will overlook, forgive and yields to them, not carrying all things to the extremity of justice.

May our love cover a multitude of sins, just as Your love has covered our own transgressions. Grant us the wisdom to overlook offenses and the grace to extend compassion, that we may live in unity and peace. We ask this in the name of Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.

02/ 22/2011~~~food for thought~~~STEADFAST LOVE IS BETTER THAN LIFE (Ps 63:3)

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"The commandments, "You shall not commit adultery," "You shall not murder," 
"You shall not steal," "You shall not covet," and whatever other command there 
may be, are summed up in this one command: "Love your neighbor as yourself." 
Love does no harm to a neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law." - Romans 13:9-10 

Our Lesson for Today:
What Paul is doing is encouraging the regenerate to do good works, he clearly 
presents them with the 10 Commandments. Then he adds "Love your neighbor."

Jesus similarly identifies this as an apt summary of the Law (Mt. 22:37-40). 
How can this be? It is because love is to place another person before self;
this is to be a "living sacrifice."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, You have loved me in Christ and declared me
to be Your righteous child. Empower me to love and serve
others through Christ. Amen


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14

Jesus similarly identifies this as an apt summary of the Law (Matthew 22:37-40). How can this be? It is because love is to place another person before self; this is to be a "living sacrifice."

Love does no harm to a neighbor. Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, humbled by Your call to live as living sacrifices, holy and pleasing to You. Help us to renew our minds, that we may discern Your good, pleasing, and perfect will. Guide us to love our neighbors as ourselves, fulfilling the law through the selfless love You have shown us. May our lives be a reflection of Your grace, as we strive to put others before ourselves. In Jesus' name, Amen.

02/23/2011~~~food for thought~~~TRUE LOVE HAS NO FEAR

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, 
because fear has to do with punishment. The one who fears 
is not made perfect in love." - 1 John 4:18 

Our Lesson for Today:
"No fear in love," ~ We need to realize that "love" real love, is the
work and will of God and the fruit of faith in God for the salvation of
every human. So in this there should be no fear. 

"perfect love casts out fear." ~ Jesus is God's perfect love that has 
come to speak and to save, not to condemn. God's love reaches its 
goal, that is, love is perfected in us when we believe in Jesus and no 
longer fear that God might still be angry with us because of our sins. 

Remember that as long as a person gives himself up to fear of God's 
punishment, he is not relying on God's Son completely for His salvation.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, I have not always loved my fellow Christian 
as I should. Forgive me and work Your love in me to cast out my 
fear of punishment. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

So in this there should be no fear. "perfect love casts out fear." ~ Jesus is God's perfect love that has come to speak and to save, not to condemn. God's love reaches its goal, that is, love is perfected in us when we believe in Jesus and no longer fear that God might still be angry with us because of our sins. Remember that as long as a person gives himself up to fear of God's punishment, he is not relying on God's Son completely for His salvation.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the perfect love that You have shown us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. We rejoice in the truth that nothing can separate us from Your love  neither death nor life, nor angels nor rulers, nor things present nor things to come (Romans 8:38-39). Help us to rest in the assurance that Your love casts out all fear (1 John 4:18), for we are secure in Your salvation through faith in Christ. May we walk in the confidence of Your unfailing love. Amen.
reflection: No fear in love, ~ We need to realize that "love" real love, is the work and will of God and the fruit of faith in God for the salvation of every human. So in this there should be no fear. "perfect love casts out fear." ~ Jesus is God's perfect love that has come to speak and to save, not to condemn. God's love reaches its goal, that is, love is perfected in us when we believe in Jesus and no longer fear that God might still be angry with us because of our sins. Remember that as long as a person gives himself up to fear of God's punishment, he is not relying on God's Son completely for His salvation.
subject: Overcome Fear Through God's Love
verse_text: There is no fear in love. But perfect love drives out fear, because fear has to do with punishment. The one who fears is not made perfect in love.

02/24/2011~~~food for thought~~~HE WILL GRACIOUSLY PROVIDE OUR EVERY NEED

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Do not those who plot evil go astray? But those who plan 
what is good find love and faithfulness." - Proverbs 14:22 

Our Lesson for Today:
The material blessings enjoyed by families should be pursued by 
prudent and diligent work done honestly. God blesses such labor 
and uses it to provide for the needs of His people. 

We should be careful to not forget that it is God who provides us 
with all that we need to support our body and life. We should also 
never resort to wickedness or dishonesty in an attempt to secure 
a better life for ourselves. 

The righteousness that comes through faith in Jesus not only delivers 
from death, but it also ensures that our Heavenly Father will provide us 
with everything we need. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, grant me the ability to believe that
because You did not spare Your own Son, You will now 
graciously give me every needed thing. Amen 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

We should also never resort to wickedness or dishonesty in an attempt to secure a better life for ourselves. The righteousness that comes through faith in Jesus not only delivers from death, but it also ensures that our Heavenly Father will provide us with everything we need.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the blessings of honest, diligent labor that You provide to sustain our families. Help us to remember that it is Your hand that supplies our needs, not our own efforts alone. May we never resort to wickedness or dishonesty in pursuit of material gain, but instead seek to walk in the righteousness that comes through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Guide us to be good stewards of all that You have entrusted to us. Amen.

02/25/2011~~~food for thought~~~PUT YOUR PLANS IN THE NAIL SCARED HANDS

Our Bible Verses for Today:
"For I know the plans I have for you," declares the LORD, "plans to prosper 
you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future. Then you will 
call on me and come and pray to me, and I will listen to you. You will seek me 
and find me when you seek me with all your heart." - Jeremiah 29:11-13 

Our Lesson for Today:
This was a letter written to the people which had been exiled because of sin.
But with God there is indeed a future hope in God's plans even for an exiled
people. 

However, after many years would God's chastisement produce the desired change 
in their lives. When they finally turned again to the Lord with all their heart, He would
keep His promise to bring them back to their homeland. 

There is an important lesson we can learn from this text ~ if we are willing to be taught.
There is a judgement awaiting all who are unwilling to follow God's plans for our lives,
but if we turn from our sins and call upon the Lord with all our heart. 

Prayer Suggestion:
O Lord, fulfill Your plans in me, and guide me to make plans that
agree with Your will.Teach me to trust Your decisions for my life,
through Jesus Christ. Amen

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the consequences of our sin and the need for Your divine guidance. Yet, we take comfort in the promise that You have plans for our lives, plans to give us a future and a hope. Even in our darkest moments, Your mercies are new every morning, and Your faithfulness never ceases. Lord, may we turn to You with all our hearts, seeking Your will and trusting in Your unfailing love. Renew our spirits, that we may walk in obedience to Your ways and experience the fullness of the life You have prepared for us. Amen.

Our Verses for Today:
"Jesus replied: "'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul 
and with all your mind.' This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second 
is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'" - Matthew 22:37-39 

The Lesson for Today:
You can find this recorded first in Deut. 6:5 ~ 
You can also find it in Lev.19 under the Holiness Code. 

In Mt. 22:36 we see that a lawyer, ask Jesus, "Which is the great 
commandment in the Law?" And we see His reply in vss. 37-39 ~ 

Significantly, Jesus' answer is thoroughly traditional. But many say: 
"Oh, that is utterly impossible for a person to keep these two commandments. 
Yes I agree, it is impossible for you to keep or perform them. 
You can't do it; ~ God must do it in you, ~ for Him it is possible. 

Seek His power daily to keep this command. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Most Gracious Lord, Your almighty power is made known chiefly 
in showing mercy and pity. Grant me the grace to lay hold of your 
promises and live forever in Your presence; through Jesus Christ. Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

02/27/2011~~~food for thought~~~THE WORD BECAME FLESH ~ AND DWELT AMONG US

Our Verse for Today:
"This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and 
only Son into the world that we might live through him." - 1 John 4:9 

Our Lesson for Today:
The important part of this verse is that the Son came that the
believer might"live through Him." How is this possible? It
is because He died, rose, and ascended into heaven so that
He might fulfil all things (Eph. 4:10). 

He is present with all believers through His chosen means of
grace; His Word, Holy Baptism, and the Lord's Supper. The
Word made flesh is our source of life, our mediator, we live
only because of Him, as Jesus Himself taught (Jn. 6:57).

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, thank You bearing all my sins on the cross
so that I might inherit eternal life. Help me to remain
faithful in my walk with You. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The important part of this verse is that the Son came that the believer might"live through Him." How is this possible? It is because He died, rose, and ascended into heaven so that He might fulfill all things (Ephesians 4:10). He is present with all believers through His chosen means of grace; His Word, Holy Baptism, and the Lord's Supper. The Word made flesh is our source of life, our mediator, we live only because of Him, as Jesus Himself taught (John 6:57).
original_verse_text: This is how God showed his love among us: He sent his one and only Son into the world that we might live through him.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that You sent Your only begotten Son, that we might have life through Him. By His death and resurrection, He has become our source of life, our mediator, and the One through whom we live. May we cling to Your Word, Baptism, and the Lord's Supper, the chosen means by which Your Son nourishes and sustains us. We praise You for this great gift of life in Christ. Amen.

02/28/2011~~~food for thought~~~JESUS LOVES US, LOVE LIKE WISE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Dear children, let us not love with words or speech but 
with actions and in truth." - 1 John 3:18 

Our Lesson for Today:
"Love" is prompted and proceeds from the truth and is carried out in
actual deeds done for the benefits and blessings of another. Whatever
tends to our brother's salvation is done "in truth."

Luth: "To love a brother who is kind and pleasant in return ~ is a trivial
matter. This is the way the world also loves. 'The crowd judges friendships
by their usefulness.' Accordingly, John does not say: 'Let us love those
who are saintly, agreeable, and rich.'

No, he says; 'Let us love the brethren, in such a way that nothing but the 
brotherhood is loved and regarded; for a brother is loved out a sense of 
duty, not because of usefulness and not because of praise. All the gifts 
we have should serve those who do not have them.

For example, he who is learned should serve him who is not learned; He
who is rich should serve him who is poor; he who is sensible should serve 
him who is foolish. 

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive my lack of real love for my
brothers and sisters, and enable me to love everyone
as Jesus has loved me. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

'The crowd judges friendships by their usefulness. Accordingly, John does not say: 'Let us love those who are saintly, agreeable, and rich. No, he says; 'Let us love the brethren, in such a way that nothing but the brotherhood is loved and regarded; for a brother is loved out a sense of duty, not because of usefulness and not because of praise. All the gifts we have should serve those who do not have them. For example, he who is learned should serve him who is not learned; He who is rich should serve him who is poor; he who is sensible should serve him who is foolish.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts filled with the desire to love one another as You have loved us. May our love not be mere words, but actions that demonstrate the truth of Your gospel. Help us to love our brothers and sisters, not for their usefulness or praise, but out of a sense of duty and care for their wellbeing. May we use the gifts and resources You have entrusted to us to serve those in need, regardless of their status or circumstances. Guide us, Lord, to love one another with genuine affection, as You have loved us. Amen.

03/01/2011~~~food for thought~~~

Our Verse for Today:
"For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, but gives us power, 
love and self-discipline." - 2 Timothy 1:7 

Our Lesson for Today:
The sending of the Holy Spirit, who equips people for Jesus' 
missions. 

The Holy Spirit's power makes our witness effective. Luth: "Its as if 
he would say, I'll place armor on you that will withstand every shot.' "

Self-discipline ~ Self-control ~ You cannot control the length of
your life - but you can control its width and depth. You cannot control
the contour of your face - but you can control its expression. You
cannot control the weather - but you can control the atmosphere of 
your mind. 

Why should we worry about things we cannot control when we can keep
ourselves busy controlling the things that depend on us?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to not be so concern about the things
I have no control over, give me the power to focus on that 
which I can control. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
original_reflection_text: The sending of the Holy Spirit, who equips people for Jesus' missions. The Holy Spirit's power makes our witness effective. Luth: Its as if he would say, I'll place armor on you that will withstand every shot. You cannot control the contour of your face - but you can control its expression. You cannot control the weather - but you can control the atmosphere of your mind. Why should we worry about things we cannot control when we can keep ourselves busy controlling the things that depend on us?

prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your Holy Spirit, who empowers us to be bold and effective witnesses for Your Son, Jesus Christ. Grant us the self-discipline, self-control, and courage to live out our faith, not worrying about the things we cannot control, but focusing on the areas where Your Spirit can work through us. May our lives reflect the atmosphere of Your love, peace, and joy, as we seek to honor You in all we do. Amen.
